definitions.definition: A common measure of intensity ratio (e.g. for sound ) that is one tenth of a bel on the logarithmic intensity scale. It is defined as dB = 10 log 10 ( P 1 / P 2 ), where P 1 and P 2 are the relative intensities.

main_definition: A common measure of intensity ratio (e.g. for sound ) that is one tenth of a bel on the logarithmic intensity scale. It is defined as dB = 10 log 10 ( P 1 / P 2 ), where P 1 and P 2 are the relative intensities.
